snippet: Mr. Scarborough, a lawmaker from Queens who was first elected in 1994, admitted submitting at least $40,000 in false expense vouchers and taking $38,000 in cash from his campaign fund for personal use.
abstract: Former New York State Assemblyman William Scarborough of Queens is sentenced in federal court to 13 months in prison for graft; is ordered to pay $54,355 in federal penalties and forfeit same amount to state; Scarborough is subsequently sentenced in state court to one year in prison to be served at same time as federal sentence for campaign finance violation.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Scarborough, a lawmaker from Queens who was first elected in 1994, admitted submitting at least $40,000 in false expense vouchers and taking $38,000 in cash from his campaign fund for personal use.

headline.main: William Scarborough, Ex-New York Assemblyman, Is Sentenced to 13 Months
headline.print_headline: Ex-Legislator Sentenced to 13 Months for Graft
